## Quickstart
To run urODK in a hosted, disposable RStudio instance, hit the "binder" button.
To install urODK in your own environment:

### Install

```{r quickstart, eval=F}
if (!requireNamespace("remotes")) {install.packages("remotes")}
remotes::install_github("dbca-wa/urODK", dependencies = TRUE, upgrade = "ask")
```

### Configure
Get credentials (un, pw) for the given ODK Central instance and run:

```{r configure}
ruODK::ru_setup(
  svc = "https://sandbox.central.opendatakit.org/v1/projects/14/forms/build_Flora-Quadrat-0-4_1564384341.svc", 
  un = "me@email.com", 
  pw = "..."
)
```

Or add to `.Renviron` via `usethis::edit_r_environ()` (with your own un and pw):

```{r eval=FALSE}
ODKC_URL="https://sandbox.central.opendatakit.org"
ODKC_PID=14
ODKC_FID="build_Flora-Quadrat-0-4_1564384341"
ODKC_UN="xxx"
ODKC_PW="xxx"
```

### Get your hands dirty
Start with a colour-by-numbers workflow example: 
If using RStudio, create a new RMarkdown workbook "from template" and select 
ruODK's template "odata", or run with a filename of your choice:

```{r, eval=FALSE}
rmarkdown::draft("my_example.Rmd", "odata", package="ruODK")
```

Follow the instructions in the workbook to explore the data.

Bonus: Create your own form at build.opendatakit.org, collect your own data.
More detail to come.
